title: Allison Mack, ‘Smallville’ Star, Sentenced to Prison in Nxivm Case
sub_head: Actress had pleaded guilty to crimes committed while she was alleged to be high-ranking member of cult-like group
body:
Allison Mack, ‘Smallville’ Star, Sentenced to Prison in NXIVM Case
Suggdek: Actress had pleaded guilty to crimes committed while she was alleged to be high-ranking member of cult-like group
Actress Allison Mack was sentenced to three years in federal prison Wednesday for racketeering and conspiracy in what prosecutors said was her high-ranking role in an upstate New York cult-like group.
Ms. Mack, best known for starring in the television series “Smallville,” in April 2019 pleaded guilty to racketeering and racketeering conspiracy charges for her part in the operation of Nxivm, a purported self-help group based near Albany.
Prosecutors said the group branded women, forced them to participate in sex acts and groomed sexual partners for Keith Raniere, Nxivm’s founder. In October, Mr. Raniere was sentenced to 120 years for crimes he committed in the group.
